def: A factor helping decide the location of a business that considers the prices they'll have to pay. A shop in London will be expensive to run.
A factor of location that considers how likely the business is to have customers. A hotel in a desert is unlikely to have customers
A factor that deals with the perception of the business. For example a wine from Italy sounds better than one from Derby
A tax on foreign goods imported into the country
Policies that governments use to protect their own national businesses against competition
Goods and services purchased from overseas by consumers of businesses
A limit on the amount of foreign goods imported into the a country
The rules businesses have to follow
The basic materials a business needs to create its products
Other businesses that compete in the same market
